item.title: 对冲基金转向绿色能源，开始押注石油
item.description:
投资组合经理一直在扭转过去四年中占主导地位的策略。【原文：

Portfolio managers have been reversing strategies that have dominated over the past four years.

】

item.title: 预报美国西部将出现火灾、暴风雨和炽热气温
item.description: 未来一周，美国西部将发生火灾、风暴，气温可能接近历史最高纪录。【原文：Fires, storms and the potential for near-record high temperatures across the western US are in the offing for the coming week.】

item.title: CATL 暂停中国锂矿生产三个月
item.description: 电池巨头当代安培科技股份有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.据熟知内情的人士透露，当代安培（Amperex）科技股份有限公司已暂停中国江西省一座大型锂矿的生产，为期至少三个月。【原文：Battery giant Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has suspended production at a major lithium mine in China’s Jiangxi province for at least three months, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 追求阳光的德国人因阿尔卑斯山度假拥堵而遭到瑞士人的反击
item.description: 瑞士对外国司机堵塞公路的容忍度越来越低，以至于一些政客现在想让他们为这一特权支付额外费用。【原文：Switzerland’s tolerance for foreign drivers clogging up its highways is wearing so thin that some politicians now want to make them pay extra for the privilege.】

item.title: 加拿大野火烟雾如何危害北美健康
item.description:
小颗粒会堵塞从肺到动脉等器官的缝隙，导致炎症和其他健康问题。【原文：

Small particles can get lodged in crevices of organs from lungs to arteries, causing inflammation and other health issues.

】

item.title: 法国葡萄酒产量将增长 17%，但野火仍是威胁
item.description: 2025 年，法国的葡萄酒产量可能会比去年增长 17%，因为去年法国各地的种植区都受到了恶劣天气的影响。【原文：France’s wine production may rise as much as 17% in 2025 compared with last year, when adverse weather hit growing regions across the country.】

item.title: 热浪对欧洲核电供应的威胁与日俱增
item.description: 欧洲各地的热浪正在增加核电厂停运的必要性，预计未来几十年情况将进一步恶化，而缓解热浪的方案却寥寥无几。【原文：Heat waves across Europe are increasing the need for nuclear power plants to be taken offline, with the situation expected to worsen in the coming decades and few options for mitigation.】

item.title: 燃烧一周的加州大火烧毁数千英亩土地
item.description: 洛杉矶西北部的一场大火已经烧毁了近 10 万英亩的土地，数百名居民在干燥的环境和强风的炙烤下四处逃命。【原文：A fire northwest of Los Angles has consumed nearly 100,000 acres and sent hundreds of residents fleeing for their lives as dry conditions and strong winds fan the flames.】

item.title: 日本的稻米作物正处于气候炊具中
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注日本的水稻作物如何在农场面临破纪录高温的情况下岌岌可危。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at how Japan’s rice crops are at risk as farms face record-breaking heat. You can also read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 拥有人工智能故事的绿色科技公司财源滚滚
item.description:
随着数据中心开发商寻求能够为人工智能提供全天候电力的无碳资源，长期以来备受冷落的核能和地热资源正受到热捧。【原文：

Long-unloved nuclear and geothermal are experiencing a boom in interest as data center developers seek carbon-free resources capable of delivering round-the-clock electricity to power artificial intelligence.

】

item.title: 为什么专家认为各州需要开展洪泛区收购业务？
item.description:
在得克萨斯州发生致命洪灾后，学者们呼吁在联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）的全面改革中实施非联邦政府资助的买断计划。【原文：

After deadly floods in Texas, academics are calling for non-federally-funded buyout programs amid FEMA’s overhaul.

】

item.title: 加拿大将目光投向新电力项目以寻求能源增长
item.description: 加拿大自然资源部长表示，随着政府采取行动提高能源产量，加拿大很可能在东西海岸新建大型输电项目。【原文：Canada is likely to see major new electricity transmission projects on the east and west coasts as the government moves to increase energy production, the country’s natural resources minister said.】

item.title: 法国火灾已得到控制，但热浪仍将加剧
item.description: 消防员说，他们在控制法国七十多年来最严重的野火方面取得了进展，小雨为在未来几天气温再次升高之前控制火势提供了机会。【原文：Firefighters say they’ve made progress containing France’s worst wildfires in more than seven decades, with light rain providing a chance to contain the blazes before temperatures rise again in the coming days.】

item.title: 在联合国寻求制定塑料条约之际，企业的回收努力却滞后了
item.description:
BloombergNEF的研究发现，消费品牌正在努力减少包装中的新塑料用量。【原文：

Consumer brands are struggling to reduce the amount of new plastic in their packaging, BloombergNEF research finds. 

】

item.title: 日本农场面临破纪录的高温，稻米产量岌岌可危
item.description: 日本创纪录的高温可能会抑制该国的大米生产，造成主食粮食短缺和新的价格飙升的威胁，因为公众对生活成本的不满情绪日益高涨。【原文：Record high temperatures in Japan could curb the country’s rice production, threatening to create shortages of the staple grain and fresh price spikes as public resentment mounts over cost of living.】

item.title: 科多公司的倒塌可能是采矿造成的，而非自然原因
item.description: 据一位直接了解此事的人士称，导致智利最大矿山 Codelco 发生致命坍塌的地震事件很可能是由采矿活动而非自然造成的。【原文：The seismic event that caused a fatal collapse at Codelco’s biggest mine in Chile is likely to have been caused by mining activity rather than nature, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普的环保局取消了对太阳能项目的 70 亿美元资助
item.description: 特朗普政府取消了一项由环境保护局管理的价值 70 亿美元的太阳能补助计划。【原文：The Trump administration canceled a $7 billion grant program for solar energy administered by the Environmental Protection Agency.】

item.title: 通用汽车将向中国 CATL 购买电动汽车电池，用于生产低成本的 Bolt 电动汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司计划从中国购买电动汽车电池，为其即将推出的入门级电动汽车提供动力，直到通过与韩国 LG Energy Solution 公司的合作关系采购到美国制造的电池为止。【原文：General Motors Co. plans to purchase electric-vehicle batteries from China to power its upcoming entry-level EV until it can procure US-made batteries through its partnership with South Korea’s LG Energy Solution.】

item.title: 在公众的强烈抗议声中，法国最高法院宣布杀虫剂法无效
item.description: 法国宪法法院宣布一项有争议的新法律中允许使用违禁杀虫剂的条款无效，此举引起了公众的广泛抗议。【原文：France’s constitutional court invalidated provisions of a controversial new law that would have allowed the use of a banned pesticide, a move that had prompted a widespread public outcry.】

item.title: 法国葡萄种植者称火灾给葡萄园造成巨大损失
item.description: 法国南部发生了 70 多年来最严重的大火，几乎可以收获的葡萄树遭到了灾难性的破坏。【原文：French wine makers have seen catastrophic damage to vines that were almost ready to be harvested after the worst fires in more than 70 years burned through the south of the country.】

item.title: 热穹即将测试美国西南部的气温记录
item.description: 本周，凤凰城和美国西南部将出现极端高温天气，气温将创下历史新高，约 750 万人将笼罩在闷热的高压穹顶之下。【原文：Extreme heat will sear down across Phoenix and the US Southwest this week, testing temperature records and putting about 7.5 million people under a sweltering high-pressure dome.】

item.title: 一些常见药物有鲜为人知的副作用
item.description:
服用某些药物治疗心脏病、过敏症和其他疾病的人患热病的风险较高。【原文：

Those taking certain drugs to treat heart diseases, allergies and other maladies are at a higher risk of heat-related illness.

】

item.title: 风险管理是正在崛起的十亿美元商机
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将带您前往德克萨斯州，那里的风险管理专业人士刚刚召开会议，讨论该行业数十亿美元的机遇。另外，能源部长克里斯-赖特（Chris Wright）一直在兜售其机构近期报告中的误导性结论。如需无限获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter takes you to Texas, where risk management professionals just convened to discuss the billion-dollar opportunity for the industry. Plus, Energy Secretary Chris Wright has been touting misleading findings from his agency’s recent report. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 最热七月排名第三，全球变暖影响甚微
item.description: 上个月只是有记录以来第三热的七月，但全球变暖带来的任何喘息机会预计都是短暂的。【原文：Last month was only the third-hottest July on record, but any respite from global warming is expected to be short-lived.】

item.title: 特朗普的最新攻击震惊了风能和太阳能产业
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对风能和太阳能的攻击正从口头上升级到实际行动上，发起了一场超出风能和太阳能行业最担心的速战速决运动。在过去短短几周内，特朗普政府实施了威胁美国风能和太阳能开发的许可审查。 它实施的标准从根本上阻止了在联邦土地上进行新的开发。它废除了拜登时代将沿海水域指定为未来风力涡轮机专用水域的决定。本周三【原文：President Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on wind and solar power from the rhetorical to the tangible, mounting a rapid-fire campaign that exceeds the industries’ worst fears.In just the past few weeks, the Trump administration instituted permitting reviews that threaten US wind and solar developments. item.title: 在华尔街和英国退出后，瑞银退出净零银行俱乐部
item.description: 继华尔街和英国银行相继离职后，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）是最新一家宣布离开全球最大气候集团的银行。【原文：UBS Group AG is the latest bank to announce it’s leaving the world’s biggest climate group for the industry, following a string of departures by Wall Street and UK banks.】

item.title: 法国消防员奋力控制 1949 年以来最严重的大火
item.description: 随着风速降低，大火的强度减弱，法国消防员用第三天的时间扑灭了该国七十多年来最严重的野火，希望能在周五之前控制住火势。【原文：French firefighters spent a third day tackling the country’s worst wildfire in more than seven decades, hoping to bring it under control by Friday as lower wind speeds reduce the intensity of the blaze.】

item.title: 气候影响 GDP 62% 的研究遭到同行批评
item.description: 科学家们对一项旗舰研究的结果提出了质疑，该研究计算出严重的气候变化可能使本世纪全球经济增长减少约 62%，该研究结果已被政策制定者和中央银行广泛引用。【原文：Scientists have challenged the findings of a flagship study that calculated severe climate change could cut global growth by about 62% this century, and which has been widely cited by policymakers and central banks.】

item.title: StanChart 与巴西阿克里州签署碳信用额协议
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）与巴西西部的阿克里州（Acre）达成了一项协议，出售其所称在未来五年内通过保护部分亚马逊雨林而产生的碳信用额度。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc has entered a deal with Acre, a state in western Brazil, to sell carbon credits it says will be generated by protecting part of the Amazon rainforest over the next half decade.】

item.title: 英国开始关键风电拍卖，成本将上升
item.description: 英国开放了最新的海上风电补贴拍卖申请，政府正努力确保足够的发电能力，以便到 2030 年实现无碳电网。【原文：The UK opened applications for the latest offshore wind subsidy auction as the government tries to secure enough capacity to make it possible to run a carbon-free electricity grid by 2030.】
